    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerHand

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getPlayerHand(int playerIndex)
        Method to access the visible cards in a player's hand
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - 0 or 1 for the players in a two player game
        Returns:
        List This returns a list of cards.

      • Stalemate

        public void Stalemate()
        Method to execute when the game is in stalemate. Accepts no parameters. If there are cards left on the stalemate piles, they are flipped over per game rules. Otherwise, the game piles are collected, shuffled, and redealt.

      • GetTopCards

        public java.util.ArrayList<Card> GetTopCards()
        Method to get a list of the visible top cards from each of the play piles
        Returns:
        ArrayList This returns the 4 cards in an ArrayList

      • PlayACard

        public boolean PlayACard(int playerIndex,
                         int cardIndex,
                         int playPileIndex)
        Method called when a card is played by a player
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - int The index number of the player who played the card (0 or 1).
        cardIndex - int The index of the card played (0-4)
        playPileIndex - The index of the pile upon which the card was played ( 0-3)
        Returns:
        True if the move is legal. False, if the move is not legal. If the move is legal, the card is removed from the players hand and added to the play pile. The player's hand is NOT replenished automatically.

      • DrawCard

        public boolean DrawCard(int playerIndex)
        Method to draw a card from the player's pile, into the player's hand
        Parameters:
        playerIndex - index number for the player (0 or 1
        Returns:
        true, if there was a card available to draw, or false, if the pile is empty.
